attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.recommendation: While the stock controls in place are generally operating effectively, it is essential to further strengthen them to ensure stock variances remain minimal at all times.
attributes.effect: The minimal variances in stock balances indicate that the stock controls in place are generally effective and efficient.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Conduct an investigation into the reasons behind the bread stock shortfall.

Establish a defined threshold for polybag variances (e.g., within +/- 10 pieces) to minimize fluctuations.

A tolerance limit for small variances should be implemented, particularly for items with minimal discrepancies like wheat bran, where such a slight overage may be expected.

value: Stock controls are effective and I will ensure accurate stock recording by keeping everything well organized and ensuring tins are full for an accurate count, minimizing variations.
Stock controls are efficient and daily polybag stock checks will be conducted to reduce variations.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.effect: Failure to meet KEBS weight standards could lead to regulatory penalties, reputational damage, and potential financial losses.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Engage with the dough makers and production staff to ensure strict adherence to the established dividing ranges for each bread variety.

Conduct a review of the proofing and baking procedures to ensure that they are aligned with standard operating procedures (SOPs) and are not contributing to inconsistencies in bread weight.

Review the use of the cooling fan in the depanning section. While the fan is crucial for employee comfort, consider adjusting the fan's power or duration to balance cooling without overcooling bread, which could contribute to underweight.

value: We will engage with the dough makers to ensure they adhere to the established dividing ranges.
We will implement process controls to minimize cases of underweight products.
800g-13%
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread damages Percentage Analysis
attributes.recommendation: The branch management is recommended to continue enforcing the current quality control measures to ensure bread damages remain within the acceptable limits.
attributes.effect: The production and market bread damage percentages were within the set limits indicating that quality control measures are effective.

value: The controls are effective, we shall ensure their continuation.
The current control measures are functioning effectively, and we will continue to uphold and reinforce them to ensure consistent efficiency and compliance.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis

value: The target achievement was impacted by low sales, which resulted in shift cuts.
The issue was resolved after follow-up, and we are actively working to achieve set targets while also considering market demand.

attributes.recommendation: Cash controls are working effectively to be maintained.

value: We will maintain the cash controls in place and improve further.

attributes.title: MiniShop Spot Check
attributes.recommendation: The branch management is recommended to maintain the current minishop stock control measures to ensure continued accuracy in sales recording and bread management.
attributes.effect: The effective stock controls in the Mini Shop indicate that all sales and bread movements are accurately recorded, minimizing discrepancies.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Maintain a frequent reconciliation process between the sales records, Mpesa paybill balance, and the physical stock levels in the Mini Shop.

Establish a protocol for reviewing and investigating any overpayments or discrepancies in the sales and cash balance records.

value: The controls are effective, we shall ensure their continuation.
The controls are effective, we shall ensure their continuation.
In prior audit dated 20th January 2025, it was observed that the stock was well controlled.

attributes.title: Debtor Analysis
attributes.recommendation: The branch management and sales team should maintain strict debt management controls to prevent overdue balances from accumulating.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Most customers have adequate security deposits, indicating that debt management is well controlled within the branch.

Develop and implement a structured follow-up system for overdue debts.

value: We will ensure timely follow-ups with sales representatives for any delayed payments while continuing to supply only to customers with adequate security deposits.
Additionally, we will strengthen follow-ups with sales representatives to ensure the timely settlement of any outstanding debts. .
During the previous audit dated 20th January 2025, the debtors amounts totaled to Ksh 9,984

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.recommendation: Maintain the controls in place with regards to optimal utilization of production workers as a resource.
attributes.effect: By exceeding the target set, the branch showcased the efficient use of human capital resources in the production section.

value: We shall ensure that targets are achieved.
We shall ensure targets are achieved and any breakdown is communicated and resolved on time.
The previous audit dated 20th January 2025, report indicated a production efficiency of 4.45 bags per production worker.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
Vehicle Mileage and Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description: The Reuben Route vehicle’s fuel consumption was within the set standard as detailed
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should collaborate with KAF to ensure the Uthiru Route vehicle’s speedometer is promptly repaired to enable proper fuel monitoring.
attributes.effect: The Reuben Route vehicle’s fuel consumption being within the set standard indicates proper fuel management and efficiency.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Escalate the issue to KAF for urgent resolution.

Follow up with KAF to ensure the speedometer is repaired

Continue monitoring fuel usage against set standards.

Document fuel consumption trends for future reference.

value: Faulty speedometer issue was communicated to KAF and we are following up to ensure it is repaired
Faulty speedometer issue was communicated to KAF and we are following up to ensure it is repaired
During the previous audit dated 20th January 2025, it noted that Uthiru Route vehicle had a faulty speedometer and its fuel consumption rate for the audit period could not be determined.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.recommendation: Both the System Generator records and the manager’s book should be reconciled and matched after calibration is performed to ensure they accurately reflect the actual fuel used, fuel filled and hours run.
attributes.effect: Unaccounted fuel could lead to increased operational costs and potential financial losses if not addressed.

value: We refuel the generator according to the tracking team's instructions, and the identified variances will be resolved through collaboration with both the tracking team and KAF.
This will then be addressed
